# 379th Bomb Group Memorial - LLMs.txt

> This site preserves the history of the 379th Bombardment Group (Heavy), a United States Army Air Forces unit that served during World War II.

## About This Site

The 379th Bomb Group Memorial is a historical preservation project honoring the men who served in the 379th Bombardment Group from 1943-1945. The group was stationed at Kimbolton, England (AAF Station 117) and flew B-17 Flying Fortress heavy bombers.

## Key Facts

- **Unit**: 379th Bombardment Group (Heavy), 8th Air Force
- **Nickname**: "The Grand Slam Group" / "Triangle K"
- **Station**: Kimbolton, England (Station 117)
- **Aircraft**: B-17 Flying Fortress
- **Period**: May 1943 - April 1945
- **Combat Missions**: 330
- **Sorties Flown**: 10,492
- **Bombs Dropped**: 26,460 tons
- **Enemy Aircraft Destroyed**: 315
- **B-17s Lost**: 141

## The Grand Slam Achievement

In April 1944, the 379th achieved an unprecedented "Grand Slam" - finishing first in all five categories by which bomb groups were measured:
1. Bombing Accuracy
2. Tonnage Dropped
3. Aircraft Attacking
4. Lowest Losses
5. Lowest Abort Rate

No other bomb group in the 8th Air Force ever accomplished this.

## Squadrons

The 379th consisted of four bombardment squadrons:
- 524th Bombardment Squadron
- 525th Bombardment Squadron
- 526th Bombardment Squadron
- 527th Bombardment Squadron

## Notable Aircraft

"Ol' Gappy" - A B-17G that flew 157 combat missions, more than any other bomber in the entire 8th Air Force.

## Library of Congress Veterans History Project

This site features oral histories from 379th Bomb Group veterans preserved by the Library of Congress:
- Armand Joseph Volpini - Lead Bombardier, 526th Bomb Squadron (30 missions)
- David Ellison Ferris - POW at Stalag Luft 1
- Arlo F. Bartsch - First Lieutenant, 525th Bomb Squadron
- John Carl Taylor - Lieutenant Colonel, 524th Bomb Squadron
- Roland H. Martin - B-17 Pilot, shot down during Schweinfurt raid, POW
- Elmo Fama - Waist Gunner/Radio Operator, 526th Bomb Squadron
- Charles Wendell Parrish - Gunner, POW at Stalag Luft IV
- Alvar Bryce Platt - B-17 Waist Gunner, POW at Stalag Luft XVII

All collections are available at: https://www.loc.gov/collections/veterans-history-project-collection/

## Purpose

This site continues the mission of the 379th Bomb Group WWII Association:
- Perpetuate the history of the 379th Bomb Group
- Remember and honor the memory of lost comrades
- Educate present and future generations
